summary: Bud (Pauly Shore) and Doyle (Stephen Baldwin) get simultaneously dumped by their eco-conscious girlfriends, Monique (Joey Lauren Adams) and Jen (Teresa Hill), in the middle of the desert. Needing a bathroom, the two friends enter what they think is a mall but soon realize is a high-profile, secure biological experiment. As they engage in a year-long battle with Dr. Faulkner (William Atherton) and the other scientists, Bud and Doyle are forced to confront the recklessness of their behavior.

reviews.content: If you are looking for immature, silly shenanigans this is the movie for you. Otherwise, it is mid at best.

I know a lot of people have already pointed out the issues with this movie so I won't drag about it. But i will tell you about one of the most tasteless and vile jokes of the movie. So it's when the two sneak into the rooms of two girl scientists. They are asleep and the two decide to sexually assault them. And let me remind you that this is played for laughs. So with that joke not only do you get the tone and what the target audience for this movie is, you can clearly see why this is one of the worst movies ever made.
This is one of the top 10 greatest films of all time and if anyone disagrees they are simply wrong.

This was rough. I tried to watch it because its free on youtube but I wasn't able to finish. Its just terrible. Its hard to put to words. The characters and dialog are the worst thing ever. Every joke just lands flat. Lines are projected with a goofy sounding teenage Californian accent that will grind you gears.

Bio-dome is really silly. It will not provide you with a compelling drama-piece or a thought-provoking cinematic experience however you will find yourself chuckling at times, rolling your eyes and, by the end. Provide you with a feeling of satisfaction and happiness. Thank's Pauly Shore - We love you! :)
Cult classic! Hilarious

This has got to be the worst movie I have ever seen.  The two actors totally act like lobotomized mentally incompacitated morons of the worst type!  Locked in a Bio-Dome where everything is calculated to be there, and one of the worst things these guys do is smoke cigarettes!

Absolutely very stupid but iconic in the same vein. I reiterate it's not cinema or a film. I laugh every time tho. Classic Pauly Shore. Violence against films everywhere. An everyman classic. Arizona bros personified.
This movie blows. It tries and fails to be funny. I saw some of it years ago and it sucks then as it does now. Avoid this piece of crap like the plauge for your own good.
Idk how to give it no stars

Pauly Shore came around when I was at the perfect age to fully *cough* appreciate what he had to offer and Bio-Dome resides in my VHS hall of fame, easily my most watched work of his.

This is the type of movie where my rating could land anywhere across the entire scale, depending on what year I am seeing it for the first time.
This is the worst movie on the planet. Burn ever copy if you see one.
Why cant they rewind the clock!!!?

As stupid as the movie is, it's pretty damn funny.

I love the idea of people being stuck in a place with a Paulie Shore character, and even better with an idiot sidekick.

Enjoyed, would watch again, and would recommend, even if its to just check off the experience.
It's ironic that a movie with an ostensibly environmentalist message is in fact absolute trash.
There should be some sort of special medal you get if you can finish this movie. An unwatchable mess.
Slapstick comedy. A little crude and raunchy, but pretty entertaining. It's a Pauly Shore movie...
Best Pauly Shore movie EVER.

This movie is not everyone's cup of tea but I thought that it was funny, sure Pauly Shore is cringe and so is S. Baldwin but that is what makes it funny. Classic 90's nostalgia throwback stoner movie of types, funny movie.
Entertaining. Not for the uptight square crowd, evident from the "critic" reviews.
Almost every single character annoys me.
Hilarious!! Favorite all time movie! Must watch lol... Old school, but makes me happy

A viewing experience so god awful, anybody who watches it gets cancer from its high amount of radioactivity. With a plot that makes zero sense whatsoever and featuring some of the worst attempts at comedy you'll ever see. This movie cemented Pauly Shore's legacy as one of the worst actors of all time. Having it being horribly acted and incredibly annoying also makes it worthy of being squandered by every film critic possible. One of the worst movies of all time, period. Overall rating: 0.

This is a crude, grotesque, pathetic college improv show parading as a ï¿ 1/2 1/2 1/2comedyï¿ 1/2 1/2 1/2ï¿ 1/2 1/2?. While I can understand the 90ï¿ 1/2 1/2 1/2(TM)s nostalgia appeal this proves to be a quintessential facet of the folly of manï¿ 1/2 1/2 1/2(TM)s hubris. Anyone trying to contend that by stating that is a ï¿ 1/2 1/2 1/2stoner filmï¿ 1/2 1/2 1/2ï¿ 1/2 1/2? for stoner people obviously has lost some brain cells. I was inebriated while watching this and it only became more belligerent and obtuse. This is a perverse and contrived effort on Pauly Shoreï¿ 1/2 1/2 1/2(TM)s part. This movie is pestilence of humor and facilitated stupidity. I can only hope that the human species is eradicated in an effort to assure no one else has to suffer the same degeneration of brain cells that I have suffered watching this. Anyone acting as a proponent of this movie need to watch something other than Ted and mall cop. Please donï¿ 1/2 1/2 1/2(TM)t let pauly shore take away from you what he has from me.

There are films that are completely unfunny when you first see them and you vow never to let your eyes grace them again. Then you pick up a job lot of old VHS and find one of these films then feel a strange urge to take another look, maybe there is something you missed....

....let's be completely honest from the get-go, Pauly Shore is Marmite, hated by most. Stephen Baldwin is the brother everyone forgets. William Atherton was still dining out on Die Hard. It's all a big melting pot of facets that don't work, and they didn't in 1996.

But it does in 2018. It's a stupid film, it's a film only to be watched when you want to watch something stupid. Think of it like Wayne's World, it's a riot of stereotypical nineties grungey nonsense that you don't want to relate with but still somehow do.

We live in a world today where everything always seems so serious and everything always seems like it is beset by problems. We originally thought films like this were garbage simply because there were a lot more things that were funny in those days. It's not like that today so watch something like Bio-Dome, it's only 95 minutes of your life. You might cringe because you see a bit of yourself on the screen, but you were fun back then and I bet you are less fun now.

End
Really funny and very underrated
Acting is terrible but nonetheless the typical Pauly Shore flick.

Bob Hope, Bing Crosby and Dorothy Lamour made a series of "Road" movies that are now considered classic comedy.  Shortly before watching Bio Dome, I had screened "The Road to Bali," and Bio Dome is much better, Just like now, audiences loved the "road" movies and critics hated them. But they were fun to watch, and  according to Bob Hope, fun to make. Bio Dome is heads and shoulders better, and will be longer lasting, than the Hope and Crosby items, and for good reason. It has a well written script and many memorable characters. Don't dismiss this movie until you've seen it. Here's an interesting fact, there is not a single f word in this movie. There's so much to laugh at, and yet no one gets hurt. Even the fart jokes are gourmet fart jokes. No one sleeps with any one they shouldn't. Jack Black plays the guitar. I actually love the portrayal of the head scientist, who knows his Black Sabbath. The set up is fast and believable. It's a buddy picture, it's the nineties version of "Road to Bali," and your grand children are going to want to watch it. Trust me on this one when I call it a classic. In a time capsule fun for all harm no one sense, it is classic. Lovely female leads, silly but handsome men, you're going to find in fifty years this one has virtues, and a plot. "Oh my God it's the grassy knoll!"  And, did I mention, a blink and you'll miss it cameo from Jack Black? He pretends to smash a guitar and then gently puts it down after singing a memorably terrible semi folk song. So funny.

A very bad movie.
I actually like Pauly Shore. I'm not saying he's an Oscar winning actor, but I like his goofy humor, and watching movies like Encino Man. But this movie tries to hard. It has bathroom humor and the main characters getting hurt. It's like watching a Disney show, but worse.

Chinese water torture or watching Bio-Dome.  Which is a more effective form of torture, hmm?  As ridiculous as that sounds, it's plausible if you've seen...this..."film".  This "film" consists of two brain dead morons sticking their tongues out and whaling them around constantly, jumping and swinging off things like retarded baboons on cocaine, air-humping, a fart-smelling-challenge flashback, and did I mention pointless, arbitrary, brain-cell-deducting gags?  Keyword there was pointless.  This is an emotionally exhausting dung heap of a "film".  I've seen bits and pieces of Pauly Shore films over the years and this one I caught on TV when I was younger, but after seeing it now in its entirety(don't know what possessed me to do such a horrible thing), I can safely advise the entire cinephile population with this: if Pauly Shore is in the starring role, look away.  Turn around.  Run.  Don't look back.  Avoid it like it was the Black Plague.  That's it, I'm done talking about this abomination.

In my opinion, the worst comedy ever. The acting is poor and Stephen Baldwin and Joey Lauren Adams can do so much better. I'm honestly glad that this wasn't a Bill and Ted sequel, because it would've ruined the characters.
Nothing to see here. Just two stupid white guys trying to outstupid each other.

I watched this movie randomly after stumbling upon a random trailer while on the deep end of youtube and it was so bad it actually inspired me to sign up for this website to review it. 

This movie is the low point of humanities venture into the cinematic arts. It is absolute garbage with zero redeeming qualities, I watched in disbelief unable to look away like watching a car crash. I metaphorically cried for all those poor extras that found themselves in the background unaware that they are contributing to the absolute worst 95 minutes of footage produced by humanity. None of the "jokes" were funny and I could not believe they would put a "funny" rape scene and then move on to the next scene like we didn't just witness the 2 stars try to rape 2 unwilling woman while they slept.

I don't know what else to say. This movie is a nightmare, it's foul, its ability to destroy faith in mankind should be studied. It should have never even seen the light of day if anyone with a brain had watched it before release and deemed it an active crime scene. And the crime? Assaulting your brain cells more efficiently than high grade meth from Walter White himself.   

Watch this movie only if you want to finally have the courage to purchase some cyanide. Probably the only thing this monstrosity of a feature length film is good for.
I took a date to see this in 1999, we didn't bang that night.
Master of Disguise in a greenhouse. Also one of the absolute worst comedies of all-time.
I was cured from a coma but after I watched this movie I would've preferred being in that coma. Irredeemable trash. In my Bottom 5
I thought it was pretty funny.
Perfect cult classic ridiculousness!
Stephen Baldwin & Pauly Shore were quite obnoxious and didn't do much with their characters in this movie.... That said Joey Lauren Adams & Kylie Minouge when she was HOT!! made this worth watching
One of my favorites!!

Pauly Shore is probably one of the funniest guys I've ever encountered and this movie proves it he goes to a place that is supposed to be sealed off and he messes with the homeostasis of the place it's funny he really is
Loved this in my teens
THIS IS WORST MOVIE EVER because the guy was farting sooo much that stinks soooo bad....... I don't like to watch this!
It's your typical NOT funny Pauly Shore comedy

Let's be honest, there's no way that this is a worse movie than Adam Sandler's worst.  I know this is considered one of the worst movies ever made, and I wouldn't entirely disagree with that, since I did give it one and a half stars.  I don't mean to even come close to suggesting that this was a good movie, but I can sort of see how the film came to have a cult following.  Yes, the writing is childish, the characters of Bud and Doyle are stupid and obnoxious and the humor leaves a lot to be desired.  But you have to admit that there's a certain chemistry between Pauly Shore and Stephen Baldwin.  There were instances where they almost break character by laughing at what the other is doing.  It seemed like they legitimately enjoyed working with each other, so, to me, that actually did add something to the movie.  Clearly not much, but it added something.  At the very least it's not like a Sandler movie where they make offensive jokes about homosexuals, minorities, women, etc, etc before going "I'm sowwy" and slapping themselves on the wrists.  It's that sort of shit that people hate about Sandler.  At the very least this movie, to me, doesn't really seek to offend.  It's just a purposely stupid movie.  And it's really hard for me to hate a movie whose entire purpose is to be as dumb as humanly possible.  Then again, one of the worst film experiences I've ever had was Date Movie and that was designed to be really fucking stupid.  I think that, perhaps, if I watched the movie on my own then I wouldn't have hated it as much.  Since I watched this in a theater full of people, that all seemed to be enjoying the movie, it made the experience worse.  If I had been watching this in a movie theater full of people, I can imagine me thinking this is considerably worse than it actually is.  Again, I'd say that this movie is bad, but I can see how it has a cult following.  I can't say that for a lot of other movies with cult followings, like, for example, Grandma's Boy, which was just a dreadful fucking movie.  I think a lot of this film's reputation has to do with the fact that Pauly Shore himself has been, pretty much, a joke.  And I can see why.  He just looks like an unfunny asshole.  And I'm not saying that there aren't valid complaints about this film, but I'm certain that like .01% of that negative reaction is due to Pauly Shore being seen as a mockery of what 'real' comedy is like.  Pauly's comedic style isn't necessarily my cup of tea, I find him obnoxious, but I'm sure there's an audience for it.  Comedy is a more open-ended genre than any other out there.  What's funny to me might not necessarily be funny to anyone else.  Same with Pauly Shore.  But, like I said, him and Stephen Baldwin have surprisingly decent chemistry and that helps make the movie slightly more bearable.  Who am I kidding, this movie, realistically speaking, is kind of awful.  But it's an awful you can laugh at and get some enjoyment from.  I wouldn't recommend it, of course, but I had some good laughs at its expense.
Bio-Dome is one of those rare films where not even a Tenacious D cameo can save it!

PAULY SHORE!
There I summed up how bad this film is
Unfortunately, I've seen this movie. If you haven't, count yourself among the fortunate and skip it altogether.

not a bad movie but not a great one either, pretty average goofy comedy. remember watching this ages ago.
I don't want to talk about it
Nah still better then jack and Jill. At least the da da da music in the background is fun to listen to.
One of the worst comedies I've ever seen
Completely horrendous. Quite possibly the worst movie I have ever seen. If you thought that Tom Green was terrible in Freddy Got Fingered, Pauly Shore makes him look like a genius.
How the hell did half the people enjoy this movie.The hell with the riddle of the Sphinx,answer me that ??????

Bio-Dome isn't quite as dumb as its lead characters, but it's largely a failure of Comedy, never able to get full mileage out of its premise. It's content to just repurpose the same old gags in a unique environment that could have been more fertile grounds for laughs but is instead just an enclosure for them. Acting is fine for a movie of this sort, with Baldwin the stoner standout.

This appalling piece of cinematic dreck feels like the embodiment of all the most puerile aspects of the 90's with none of the more entertaining ones. The fact that these two troglodytes force you to root for William Atherton's attempts to slaughter them mercilessly go to prove just how much of a failure this is as not simply a comedy, but a form of entertainment in general. Honestly, if it were possible I'd give this film a negative score, though I'm uncertain what would be sufficient.

I was very attracted to the concept of this movie: Take Pauly Shore and enclose him forever under a soundproof, airtight dome, severed from society for eternity. Unfortunately, the director made the ill choice of placing the camera on the inside of the dome. As opposed to the outside of the dome, where I presumed, since this is a film and as such is meant to entertain. It would have been very entertaining indeed to see Pauly Shore suffocate and die trapped within an airtight dome over the course of 1 hour and 28 minutes. But, that's not what we get. Instead, smarter minds than I teamed Pauly with Baldwin brother turned batsh*t crazy born again Christian Stephen Baldwin (the second most annoying person on the planet, eclipsed only by...Pauly Shore) for the tale of two morons (good casting) who get locked in a science experiment with environmental scientists for one year. One critic said this "is a 50/50 movie, either you love it or you hate it." I'd describe it more as a 100/0 movie: you hate it. I read that Pauly Shore once said, "Even at my peak, I never went too over the top." Well, if your peak only reaches the lowest depths of hell, it's kinda hard to even see a top over which you can go. So, to summarize: I'd rather watch Rosey Grier clip his toenails for an hour and a half than see "Bio-Dome" again.

For a simple stoner comedy, "Bio-Dome" has a pretty high concept plot and a lot of ridiculous messages about saving the environment even though it's nothing more than yet another moron movie. Back in the 1990's, there was a big push to make Pauly Shore a movie star whether audiences wanted him or not, and thankfully, most of his films were soundly rejected.

Shore's movies were mostly made for people who found Adam Sandler's brand of humor too high brow, and this one plays like something even Sandler would have passed on. It follows the same formula, and much of the alleged humor feels improvised, especially from the star and his sidekick, played by Stephen Baldwin. In many scenes, Shore seems to be having a hard time laughing, a sure sign that he's hearing much of this for the first time.

All I can say is that I'm glad someone was having fun with this dim, idiotic material. There's not one funny moment in the entire picture, and I imagine you would have to be very easy to please to find this anything more than just an insufferable mess. But, typical of movies of this nature, the two leads have impossibly hot girlfriends who for some reason find their inability to articulate sentences charming and they both become heroes in the end when they succeed in righting every wrong they've committed all in the name of "comedy."

In that respect, "Bio-Dome" plays like a fantasy for morons everywhere. It seems to suggest that the slacker lifestyle will make all of your dreams a reality, or maybe I just had too much time to over-think this dud during all the downtime when I wasn't laughing.
So dumb but i loved it. It actually rates well with me.
Really stupid, but has its moments. passed the 3 laughs test.
this movie is worse than anus cancer in the balls
There is absolutely nothing salvageable about this movie at all. It's hands down one of the worst comedies I've ever seen.
It is one of the worst movies of all time. And even though I am able to acknowledge that it is so, I still find myself cracking up and loving it. I don't..... I don't know.
Unwatchably bad. I couldn't even sit through the first hour of it. It's just Pauly Shore and Stephen Baldwin being as annoying as humanly possible.
Silly, but likely a great time if you're completely smashed.
This movie is trying too hard to be "stupid to be funny". It extremely hard to watch and at times can make you sick with disgustingly bad scenes. DO NOT WATCH!
Pauly Shore REALLY sucks.
Made for stoners & party boy's. I would buy the soundtrack not the movie.
Quite possibly the worst film ever.

Trying to impress their environmentally-active girlfriends, two losers instead find themselves trapped for a year inside a bio-dome meant for scientists and study. As the great critic once say "I hated this movie. Hated hated hated hated hated this movie. Hated it".
One star for nostalgia, the other for making me laugh.  But holy crap, that was dumb.
It's bad, as expected.

this is the only movie in history more annoying than Freddie got Fingered!! What does that tell ya. The idea of humor and this filth are two completely different entities that travel away from each other at ever increasing speeds for eternity. Simply put, carnival trash.

Oh my god, where do I start with this piece of crap film.  These two annoying idiots Pauly Shore and Stephen Baldwin make Tracey Morgan look like the king of comedy.  The script is terrible, the acting is atrocious, and these two idiots had me siding with the villain at the end of the movie.  Thank god, this filmed failed.  I give it 0 stars and I recommend everybody stay clear of it, so you won't feel unclean from it like I do.
I cannot imagine a film as obnoxious and annoying as this one.
Yeah, it's bad. But I don't think it's THAT bad like how the reviewers of this movie made it look like.

The first half is completely idiotic, the second half finally picks up some intelligence. But already I've wasted 1 hour and 35 minutes of my life watching this putrid piece of junk and Pauly Shore and Stephen Baldwin are just aggravating to sit through...

This is right on the level of Night at the Roxbury for comedy.  Amateurish directing,  a paint by the numbers plot but a good message and it killed "comedian" Pauly Shore's career. But, it's job is to make us laugh in an mindless way. Definitely accomplished. Critics hated it but who the hell cares? The soundtrack was pure 90's as well and a career booster for Joey Lauren Adams (Chasing Amy) Sometimes a bad movie is fun to watch. Grade: C

A dumb buddy comedy involves Pauly Shore and Stephen Baldwin who are slacker losers who have environmentally friendly girlfriends, but want nothing to do with that so they leave them. The girls call them to make them jealous and they chase after them, they end up at the bio-dome due to a bathroom break and end up getting stuck in since it is an experiment. They use that to get their girlfriends back, but they end up getting disowned from the scientists because of their hijinks. They also find an escape and find a way to throw a party at the dome in an attempt to truly win their girlfriends, but it ruins the experiment even further. But this is a movie, so they try to fix it, with only a crazed scientist as their enemy.

This movie is dumb, but it has its moments. However, there just aren't enough of them to make this truly memorable. It is close, but it just misses the mark.

Ear rapingly terrible, one of the most obnoxious, un-funny movies I've ever seen. I'm not sure if they were trying to cash in on the 'Wayne's World'/'Dumb and Dumber' formula of the 90's but if they were, good God, they failed. Easily in my top 5 worst movies of all time.
classic stupidity a stoner bible on hot summer nights.
WOW...just wow. This movie KILLED comedy! That is how BAD THIS TRAINWRECK OF MOVIE IS!
I may have laughed once, but I was still interested in studying the improv skills of Baldwin and Shore.
Gives me a chuckle here and there.

seriously? 5%? did any of the professional reviewers/critics watch this high? that's a prerequisite, duh. FREE THE MAHI-MAHI !! this may or may not be responsible for bringing pauly's career to a screeching halt in late 90s. If you can appeciate the brilliance of dumb and dumber, bio-dome is for you :^)
Probably the Citizen Kane of my generation.
i dislike pauly shore. thus i may have prejudged this film. but i can say that i laughed more than i thought i would.

THIS IS AWFUL! I MEAN, AWFUL! I mean, I don't think I've seen a more annoying and obnoxious piece of cancerous ass. It's so grading and ear-rapingly bad that I'm surprised the movie itself hasn't been arrested for indecent exposure! It may not be the worst movie, but trust me, it's the top 5. All the parts that are funny have been replaced by a cauldron of annoyance. I just can't comprehend how bad this movie is. It's just two really unfunny people doing really unfunny things and confusing it for something really funny. I haven't been aggrivated by a movie like this for a long, long time...and that's saying something after all the movies I've seen.

Now I have a lot more time to review movies due to summer, and why not start with one of the worst films I've ever seen: Bio-Dome? It has untalented actors, a predictable plot, and a wretched, awful sense of humor that isn't even slapstick, but like...Beavis and Butthead-like humor.
It follows two idiot friends, Bud "Squirrel" Macintosh and Doyle Johnson. You know the film will be awful when Pauly Shore is in it already, but add in Baldwin and you make a recipe for disaster. The two hit each other with books and sit around, munching on snacks and being lazy. After they believe their girlfriends have had sex with their hippie buddies, Squirrel and Doyle go off to find them but accidentally stumble into the Bio-Dome, a place where 5 scientists conduct experiments and trap themselves in the dome for a year. Squirrel and Doyle once again do idiotic things until they bust out...and do more idiotic things. The plot clearly isn't much.
Like I just said, there's barely any plot, rather just an excuse for a lame buddy comedy targeted for stoners. This is one of the worst movies I've ever seen, and I know I can't be the only one. Why is it so dumb? Why did people even think it was funny? Why did Stephen Baldwin EVER get into acting? It's like a dumber version of Bill and Ted, only it's more '90s than '80s. Believe me, it's 90s enough. The fashion, the constant grunge music, just the vibe feels like it's too 1990s. The whole film is annoying, has barely any plot, and is one of the dumbest comedies ever made.

Top 10: Worst Films

1. Battlefield Earth (2000)

2. Freddy Got Fingered (2001)

3. North (1994)

4. Showgirls (1995)

5. Howard The Duck (1986)

6. Leonard Part 6 (1987)

7. Bio-Dome (1996)

8. An Alan Smithee Film: Burn, Hollywood, Burn (1998)

9. Jack And Jill (2011)

10. Disaster Movie (2008)

Imagine two mentally challenged people who smoked 1,000 joints and were in a scientific experiment trapped in a dome, and that still isn't even close to how bad this movie is. It's unfunny, annoying, and beyond stupid. Easily one of the worst movies ever made.
There's a chance, just a small one, that Pauly Shore is the most irritating comedian in existence.
awesome throw back comedy from the 90s. if u think your mature don't bother. but if you enjoy a good fart joke every now and again. Biodome hits the toilet seat!

Somewhere in an alternate dimension or in the mind of total idiots this is considered a good movie or entertaining. This movie sucks so much that Steve Baldwin had to find God.

The worst movie I have Ever seen. Most of it doesn't even have a plot, it's nothing more than Pauly Shore and Stephen Baldwin walking like monkeys for no apparent reason and making ear piercing noises. This movie Insulted me and every possible aspect of movie making. It has a cliched and not well thought out story line. Clearly they focused more on annoying the audience with Pauly Shore and Stephen Baldwin more than Anything.
I don't want to live on this planet anymore.
Such a silly classic.
At the start of the movie it was kind of funny and kind of amusing if you're into really stupid humor but as the movie goes on the story doesn't get interesting and the humor gets really old
